rajawali.materials.textures

Class ATexture

  • java.lang.Object
    • rajawali.renderer.AFrameTask
      • rajawali.materials.textures.ATexture
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ACompressedTexture, AMultiTexture, ASingleTexture, FrameBufferTexture, VideoTexture

    public abstract class ATexture
extends AFrameTask

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  ATexture.FilterType
      Texture filtering or texture smoothing is the method used to determine the texture color for a texture mapped pixel, using the colors of nearby texels (pixels of the texture).
      static class  ATexture.TextureException 
      static class  ATexture.TextureType
      Texture types
      static class  ATexture.WrapType
      You can assign texture coordinates outside the range [0,1] and have them either clamp or repeat in the texture map.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class rajawali.renderer.AFrameTask

        AFrameTask.TASK, AFrameTask.TYPE

    • Field Detail

      • mTextureId

        protected int mTextureId
        The texture id that is used by Rajawali

      • mUniformHandle

        protected int mUniformHandle
        The uniform handle represents the sampler location in the shader program

      • mWidth

        protected int mWidth
        Texture width

      • mHeight

        protected int mHeight
        Texture height

      • mBitmapFormat

        protected int mBitmapFormat
        Possible bitmap configurations. A bitmap configuration describes how pixels are stored. This affects the quality (color depth) as well as the ability to display transparent/translucent colors. Config

      • mMipmap

        protected boolean mMipmap
        Indicates whether mipmaps should be created or not. Mipmaps are pre-calculated, optimized collections of images that accompany a main texture, intended to increase rendering speed and reduce aliasing artifacts.

      • mShouldRecycle

        protected boolean mShouldRecycle
        Indicates whether the source Bitmap or Buffer should be recycled immediately after the OpenGL texture has been created. The main reason for not recycling is Scene caching. Scene caching stores all textures and relevant OpenGL-specific data. This is used when the OpenGL context needs to be restored. The context typically needs to be restored when the application is re-activated or when a live wallpaper is rotated.

      • mTextureName

        protected java.lang.String mTextureName
        The texture name that will be used in the shader.

      • mTextureType

        protected ATexture.TextureType mTextureType
        The type of texture {link ATexture.TextureType

      • mWrapType

        protected ATexture.WrapType mWrapType
        Texture wrap type. See ATexture.WrapType.

      • mFilterType

        protected ATexture.FilterType mFilterType
        Texture filtering type. See ATexture.FilterType.

      • mBitmapConfig

        protected Config mBitmapConfig
        Possible bitmap configurations. A bitmap configuration describes how pixels are stored. This affects the quality (color depth) as well as the ability to display transparent/translucent colors. See Config.

      • mMaterialsUsingTexture

        protected java.util.List<Material> mMaterialsUsingTexture
        A list of materials that use this texture.

      • mCompressedTexture

        protected ACompressedTexture mCompressedTexture
        The optional compressed texture

      • mGLTextureType

        protected int mGLTextureType
        The OpenGL texture type

      • mOwnerIdentity

        protected java.lang.String mOwnerIdentity
        This texture's unique owner identity String. This is usually the fully qualified name of the RajawaliRenderer instance.

      • mInfluence

        protected float mInfluence

      • mRepeat

        protected float[] mRepeat

      • willRecycle

        public boolean willRecycle()
        Returns:
        the a boolean describin whether the source Bitmap or Buffer should be recycled immediately after the OpenGL texture has been created. The main reason for not recycling is Scene caching. Scene caching stores all textures and relevant OpenGL-specific data. This is used when the OpenGL context needs to be restored. The context typically needs to be restored when the application is re-activated or when a live wallpaper is rotated.

      • shouldRecycle

        public void shouldRecycle(boolean shouldRecycle)
        Parameters:
        shouldRecycle - Indicates whether the source Bitmap or Buffer should be recycled immediately after the OpenGL texture has been created. The main reason for not recycling is Scene caching. Scene caching stores all textures and relevant OpenGL-specific data. This is used when the OpenGL context needs to be restored. The context typically needs to be restored when the application is re-activated or when a live wallpaper is rotated.
